answers.content_html: 0.15\,\text{J}
answers.feedback_html: Remember that pressure-volume work equals the product of change in volume and pressure.

answers.content_html: 6.7\,\text{J}
answers.feedback_html: Work is not equal to the given pressure divided by the change in volume.

answers.content_html: 23\,\text{J}
answers.feedback_html: The sum of the given pressure and change in volume does not yield the value of work done.

answers.content_html: 60\,\text{J}
answers.feedback_html: The product of the change in volume and pressure equals the pressure-volume work done by the system.

stem_html: What is the pressure-volume work done by a system if a pressure of 20\,\text{Pa} causes a change in volume of 3.0\,\text{m}^3?

answers.content_html: Pressure is force divided by length.
answers.feedback_html: The pressure in given in \text{SI} units of newton’s per square meter.

answers.content_html: Pressure is force divided by area.
answers.feedback_html: Force divided by area is called pressure.

answers.content_html: Pressure is force divided by volume.
answers.feedback_html: Pressure is not equivalent to force per unit volume.

answers.content_html: Pressure is force divided by mass.
answers.feedback_html: This describes acceleration, not pressure.

answers.content_html: oxidative phosphorylation
answers.feedback_html: The \text{NADH} produced during glycolysis undergoes oxidative phosphorylation where it transfers its electrons to the electron transport chain. The \text{H}^{+} {\!} ions pumped as the electrons move are used to produce ATP with the help of ATP synthase.

answers.content_html: substrate-level phosphorylation
answers.feedback_html: Recall that, in substrate-level phosphorylation, one ATP is produced at a time. Also, the ADP phosphorylation is coupled with the exergonic breakdown of a high energy bond.

answers.content_html: dephosphorylation of ATP
answers.feedback_html: Dephosphorylation breaks down ATP, rather than generates it.

answers.content_html: hydrolysis of ATP
answers.feedback_html: Hydrolysis refers to the breakdown of a substance by the addition of water molecule. It does not produce ATP.

stem_html: What biochemical process generates the most ATP during the breakdown of glucose?

answers.content_html: discovery
answers.feedback_html: A discovery is not a testable explanation for an event.

answers.content_html: hypothesis
answers.feedback_html: A hypothesis is a proposed explanation for a phenomenon that can be tested.

answers.content_html: scientific method
answers.feedback_html: The scientific method is a method of research with defined steps.

answers.content_html: theory
answers.feedback_html: A theory is a broad explanation for a long number of observations and tested hypotheses.

stem_html: What is a suggested and testable explanation for an event called?

answers.content_html: The average kinetic energy of the gas particles decreases, so the balloon becomes colder.
answers.feedback_html: Temperature is a measure of the average kinetic energy of the gas particles, and is directly proportional to the volume of the gas if pressure is held constant. Therefore, as volume decreases, so does the temperature (i.e., average kinetic energy of the particles), and the balloon becomes colder.

answers.content_html: The average kinetic energy of the gas particles increases, so the balloon becomes hotter.
answers.feedback_html: Remember, if pressure is constant, temperature is directly proportional to the volume, so for temperature (that is, the average kinetic energy of the gas particles) to increase, the volume must also increase, causing the balloon to become larger, not smaller in size.

answers.content_html: The average potential energy of the gas particles decreases, so the balloon becomes colder.
answers.feedback_html: The potential energy of the gas particles does not affect temperature, which is changed because of the change in volume.

answers.content_html: The average potential energy of the gas particles increases, so the balloon becomes hotter.
answers.feedback_html: Remember that temperature is directly proportional to volume when pressure is constant, and that the average kinetic energy of particles determines temperature.

stem_html: When an inflated balloon experiences a decrease in size, the air pressure inside the balloon remains nearly constant. If there is no transfer of energy by heat to or from the balloon, what physical change takes place in the balloon?

answers.content_html: Insects can walk on water because of its high surface tension.
answers.feedback_html: Some insects can walk on water, although they are denser than water, because of the high surface tension of water. High surface tension results from high cohesion at the surface of a body of water.

answers.content_html: Insects can walk on water because it is a polar solvent.
answers.feedback_html: Recall whether the polarity of water has anything to do with insects walking on water.

answers.content_html: Insects can walk on water because they are less dense than water.
answers.feedback_html: Most insects are not less dense than water.

answers.content_html: Insects can walk on water because they are denser than water.
answers.feedback_html: Most insects are denser than water, but many of them can still be supported on the surface of water.

stem_html: Why can some insects walk on water?

answers.feedback_html: This is not the correct sequence.
This is not the correct sequence.
2, 1, 5, 4, 6, 3 is the correct sequence of the situation given.
This is not the correct sequence.

stem_html:
Although the scientific method is used by most of the sciences, it can also be applied to everyday situations. A situation is given below. Using the scientific method try to arrange the given steps in the correct order. Situation:
  1. If the car doesn’t start the problem might be in the battery.
  2. Car doesn’t start.
  3. After changing the battery. Car starts working.
  4. The car should start after charging the battery or changing the battery.
  5. The car doesn’t start because the battery is dead.
  6. The car doesn’t start even after charging the battery, the battery must have stopped working.

answers.content_html: metagenomics
answers.feedback_html: Metagenomics is the study and analysis of genetic material that are collected from the environment.

answers.content_html: linkage analysis
answers.feedback_html: Risk assessment of genetic diseases cannot be determined by linkage analysis. Linkage analysis is used to study linkage of two genes responsible for diseases.

answers.content_html: genomics
answers.feedback_html: Genomics can determine the chances of occurrence of genetic diseases in an individual’s children.

answers.content_html: shotgun sequencing
answers.feedback_html: Shotgun sequencing is used to sequence long strands of DNA.

stem_html: The risks of genetic diseases for an individual’s children can be determined through ____.

answers.content_html: diseases affecting humans, pollution affecting species habitat, calculating surface area of rectangular ground, functioning of planetary orbitals
answers.feedback_html: Diseases affecting humans and pollution affecting species habitat are the two topics that can be studied by biologists while calculating surface area of rectangular ground and the functioning of planetary orbitals are two topics that fall outside of the realm of biology.

answers.content_html: calculating surface area of rectangular ground, functioning of planetary orbitals, formation of metamorphic rocks, galaxy formation and evolution
answers.feedback_html: All of these are outside the realm of biology.

answers.content_html: plant responses to external stimuli, functioning of planetary orbitals, formation of metamorphic rocks, galaxy formation and evolution
answers.feedback_html: All of these are outside the realm of biology except for plant responses to external stimuli.

answers.content_html: plant responses to external stimuli, study of the shape and motion of physical objects, formation of metamorphic rocks, galaxy formation and evolution
answers.feedback_html: All of these are outside the realm of biology except for plant responses to external stimuli.

stem_html: What are two topics that are likely to be studied by biologists and two areas of scientific study that would fall outside the realm of biology?

answers.content_html: {-190}\,\text{J} ; this would change if heat added energy after the work was done
answers.feedback_html: The energy added by heat is greater than the work done by the system, so the change in internal energy should be positive. The change in internal energy would also remain the same.

answers.content_html: 190\,\text{J}; this would change if heat added energy after the work was done
answers.feedback_html: The change in internal energy would be the same even if the heat added energy after the work was done.

answers.content_html: {-190}\,\text{J}; this would not change even if heat added energy after the work was done
answers.feedback_html: The work done is less than the energy added by heat. Hence, the change in internal energy should be positive.

answers.content_html: 190\,\text{J}; this would not change even if heat added energy after the work was done
answers.feedback_html: The change in internal energy would be 190\,\text{J}. If heat added energy after the work was done, the change in internal energy would be the same.

stem_html: Three hundred ten joules of heat enter a system, after which the system does 120\,\text{J} of work. What is the change in its internal energy? Would this amount change if the energy transferred by heat were added after the work was done instead of before?
